page.title: 12Peat Cutting,Wick
page.content: Families work as a team with one cutting, one lifting the peats out of the bank and a few others laying them on the ground. It takes about one month for each side of the peat to dry so they have to be turned. After that you have to stack them in threes so that the air can pass through. Once they have dried they are taken home by tractor or trailer and stacked like a black house with spaces to let in the air.In winter you put a cover over them, as they have to be dry to burn well. A modern machine,which cuts tubular peats from the bank,is now used by some people to take the hard work out of this task.
